item.title: LLM
item.description:
Understanding LLMs: From Pretraining to Post‑Training

At the pretraining stage, an LLM (large language model) acquires knowledge from the internet and stores it in the parameters of a neural network. This produces what we call a base model—a token autocompleter. Then we apply supervised fine‑tuning (SFT) on curated conversation data. This shapes the model’s “personality,” essentially creating a lossy simulation of a human labeler.

Pretraining

All pages on the internet are filtered and combined into one massive text corpus.
This text is then tokenized into a sequence of finite symbols (tokens).
